title: hub.get Response Application Programming Interface (API) Schema
description: Response containing the current Notehub configuration for the Notecard.

host.description: The URL of the Notehub host.

inbound.description: The max wait time, in minutes, to sync inbound data from Notehub.

mode.description: The current operating `mode` of the Notecard, as defined in `hub.set`.

sub-descriptions.description: Periodically connect to the Notehub. This is the default value set on each Notecard after a factory reset.
Enables an always-on network connection, for high power devices. Outbound data still syncs periodically, unless specified in a Note or File request.
Disables periodic connection. The Notecard will not sync until it receives an explicit `hub.sync` request. OTA DFU updates are not available when using this mode.
Disables automatic and manual syncs. `hub.sync` requests will be ignored in this mode. OTA DFU updates are not available when using this mode.
Puts the Notecard in DFU mode for IAP host MCU firmware updates. This mode is effectively the same as `off` in terms of the Notecard's network and Notehub connections.

outbound.description: The max wait time, in minutes, to sync outbound data from the Notecard.

product.description: The ProductUID to which the Notecard is registered.

sn.description: The serial number of the device, if set.

sync.description: `true` if the device is in `continuous` mode and set to sync every time a change is detected.

vinbound.description: If `inbound` has been overridden with a voltage-variable value.

voutbound.description: If `outbound` is overridden with a voltage-variable value.

samples.title: Notehub Configuration Response
samples.description: Response with current Notehub configuration settings.
